review: Nothing to add other than what has been said before about the product.  Looking to cut the cable for all but internet connectivity I have been using Chromecast for about two weeks.  The bigger challenge in cutting the cable and casting to TVs is the programming beyond just movie watching.  Netflix, Amazon Prime and others are easy and the quality of the video stream to Chromecast is extremely good (I have a 20+MB download internet service/Netgear wireless router).  Live TV is the challenge and having a account is really required.  If you can get a logon to a cable provider from a friend or relative  you are pretty good to go.Amazingly casting seems to work best using cell phone connected to WiFi better than a desktop computer but have no doubt this is not nearly as high resolution live streaming as a regular cable connection.  Casting movies, Netflix and Amazon is just as good as any connectivity but not live streaming like NFL Game Day (Plz don't ask me how I do that from here in the U.S.. Do your research.  It is easy and it works.)
author: VinceC
